entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Version'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM
  as select distinct from zdcp_fp_it_m_key as objtype
  // as select distinct from I_OutputControlApplObjectType as objtype
  //   inner join            zdcp_fp_pdf_form              as pdfform on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = pdfform.iv_object_type
  inner join            zdcp_fp_pdf_form              as pdfform on objtype.iv_object_type = pdfform.iv_object_type

{
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 10
      } ]
      @ui.selectionField: [{position: 10 }]
      // @Consumption.filter.defaultValue: 'PURCHASE_ORDER'

  key objtype.iv_object_type

}

entry.title: Release Navigator for Supply Chain Management - What's New in 2508
entry.content:
Greetings Supply Chain Management Community,

In today's rapidly evolving technology landscape, staying ahead in supply chain management requires innovation and adaptability. We understand that managing complex solutions efficiently is crucial for maintaining competitiveness and driving growth. That’s why I am thrilled to announce a new UX and content update to the release navigator tailored specifically for supply chain management users, scheduled to complete by August 22. This upcoming update promises a refreshed supply chain calendar, strategies, and resources. Whether you're tackling demand forecasting, optimizing logistics, or integrating emerging technologies, this update to the release navigator will equip you with the enablement to increase innovation adoption.

 

ShoutOut Messages

Coming soon, ShoutOuts (see Figure 1: ShoutOut Messages) will be one of the latest additions to enhance announcements within the release navigator. This dynamic feature is designed to keep you informed about the latest updates, new features, and fresh content that we continually bring to the platform. ShoutOuts will provide timely announcements that disappear after a limited period, ensuring that your user experience remains smooth and uninterrupted, yet informed. I encourage you to regularly check in during the pre-release phase to stay informed about critical changes and exciting developments. This proactive approach will help you make the most of our offerings and ensure you're always abreast of what’s new and noteworthy. Stay tuned, and don't miss out on any vital information or transformative updates.

Figure 1: ShoutOut Messages

 

Insight to Pages

Insight to Pages will be a new guided assistance resource seamlessly integrated into the interface to enrich your navigation experience. Now, every main page accessible from the Side Menu features a distinct dark blue lightbulb icon (see Figure 2: Insights to Pages) adjacent to the page header, serving as a trigger to insights into the content housed within each section. This innovative feature is thoughtfully designed to elucidate the organization of content, empowering users with a clearer understanding of what each page offers. Additionally, these insights provide a comprehensive Walk-Thru around each section, ensuring that users can navigate efficiently and make the most of the available resources. We invite you to take a closer look today and explore how Insight to Pages can enhance your journey through our platform, making navigation intuitive and information more accessible than ever before.

Figure 2: Insight to Pages

 

Welcome & Release Calendar Cards 

We have refreshed the designs of two essential features: the Welcome card and the Release card (see Figure 3: Welcome & Release Calendar cards), both of which have undergone significant updates to enhance your user experience. The Welcome card now boasts a captivating themed image that warmly invites you into our platform, setting the tone for an engaging and insightful journey. Meanwhile, the Release card has been reimagined to offer a more streamlined presentation of information—release events are now conveniently grouped by month, allowing for effortless navigation through upcoming updates. These enhancements are thoughtfully crafted to provide clarity and a visually appealing interface that fosters an intuitive and user-friendly experience. 

Figure 3: Welcome & Release Calendar cards

 

Below is a table of 2508 release content within the release navigator, that has been added or updated.

Product/ToolContentStatus
Release NavigatorWhat's New in 2508Pending
SAP Asset Performance ManagementRelease BlogPending
SAP Business NetworkSAP Help PortalPending
SAP Digital ManufacturingRelease BlogPending
SAP Field Service ManagementRelease BlogPending
SAP Information Collaboration HubRelease StrategyPending
SAP Integrated Business PlanningRelease BlogPending
 Sneak PreviewPublished
 Changes Requiring Customer ActionPublished
 New & Changed FeaturesPublished
Transportation Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionRelease BlogPending
Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionRelease BlogPending

 

To reduce the impact on your user experience, the Release Navigator for Supply Chain Management only includes new UX elements once a year, when new release content is also updated.

As a reminder, the release navigator is automatically updated for you over the next few weeks. No tasks are required from you the user.

 

We value your input and encourage you to share any feedback or specific content requests for future updates to the release navigator. Please feel free to complete our feedback survey or contribute your suggestions in the Comments section below this post.

To explore more about how the Readiness@Scale team is dedicated to overseeing release readiness within the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, visit our Release Ready page. Additionally, you can find all our team's blog posts by searching the tag  Readiness@Scale. Thank you for your continued engagement and support.

 

Always Bring Your Best,

Andrew Ford
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
Added  CDS View entity ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM as it is used by the Main CDW View entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3.

I have also modified the following objects, which are different than the original

  1. CDS View entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3
  2. FM ZGENERATE_PDF_XSTRING.

See the attachments

FUNCTION zgenerate_pdf_xstring.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_OBJECT_TYPE) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_OBJECT_NR) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(IV_VERSION_NR) TYPE  VERSNR_KK
*"     REFERENCE(IV_FYEAR) TYPE  /ACCGO/E_FISCAL_YEAR
*"     REFERENCE(IV_CC) TYPE  /ACCGO/E_COMPANYCODE_VH
*"  EXPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_DOCUMENT_DATA) TYPE  XSTRING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_PAGES) TYPE  FPPAGECOUNT
*"     REFERENCE(EV_TRACE_STRING) TYPE  STRING
*"     REFERENCE(EV_STOP_PROCESSING) TYPE  ABAP_BOOL
*"     REFERENCE(EV_PDL_TYPE) TYPE  APOC_PDL_TYPE
*"     REFERENCE(ET_MESSAGE) TYPE  CL_SOMU_FORM_SERVICES=>TY_GT_MESSAGE
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ty_gs_fdp_key,
      name  TYPE string,
      value TYPE string,
    END OF ty_gs_fdp_key .
  TYPES:
    ty_gt_fdp_key TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_gs_fdp_key WITH EMPTY KEY .
  DATA wa_message TYPE LINE OF cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA: it_master_keys    TYPE ty_gt_fdp_key .
  DATA: ls_master_keys    TYPE name2stringvalue_table, wa_ls_master_keys TYPE name2stringvalue.
*NAME2STRINGVALUE
  DATA lv_pq_name      TYPE pq_qname.
  DATA lv_xml_in       TYPE xstring.
  DATA lv_stop         TYPE boole_d.
  DATA: it_key          TYPE ty_gt_fdp_key, ls_appl_keys    TYPE name2stringvalue_table, wa_ls_appl_keys TYPE ty_gs_fdp_key.
  DATA lo_hlp          TYPE REF TO if_apoc_or_h_factory_internal.
  DATA lo_fp_srv       TYPE REF TO if_apoc_somu_form_services.
  DATA render_options TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gs_render_options.
  DATA ls_merge_doc    TYPE if_apoc_document_merge=>document_object.
  DATA lt_msg          TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA lt_msg_all      TYPE cl_somu_form_services=>ty_gt_message.
  DATA lv_xml_out      TYPE xstring.
  DATA lv_pdl_type     TYPE apoc_pdl_type.
  DATA: pdf_form TYPE  fpwbformname VALUE 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER', pdf_mfor TYPE apoc_form_master_template_id VALUE 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_ORDER_MASTER'  .
  DATA wa_zdcp_fp_forms_mv TYPE zdcp_fp_forms_mv.
  PERFORM set_default_keys  USING iv_object_type iv_object_nr iv_version_nr CHANGING ls_master_keys ls_appl_keys pdf_form pdf_mfor.


* Object Type specific
  CASE iv_object_type.
    WHEN 'PURCHASE_ORDER'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseOrder'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseOrderChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseContract'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'PurchaseContractChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'SALES_CONTRACT'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesContract'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesContractChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesOrder'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesOrderChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'SALES_QUOTATION'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesQuotation'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesQuotationChangeFlag'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesDocument'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.

      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'ReceiverID'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'ReceiverRole'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'SalesDocument'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'ReceiverID'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
      APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'ReceiverRole'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value = ''.
    WHEN 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-name = 'BillingDocument'.
      wa_ls_appl_keys-value =  iv_object_nr.
  ENDCASE.

  APPEND wa_ls_appl_keys TO ls_appl_keys.
*Validate the Document
  CASE iv_object_type.
    WHEN 'PURCHASE_ORDER'.
      SELECT SINGLE ebeln FROM ekko INTO @DATA(lv_ebeln) WHERE ebeln = @iv_object_nr.
      IF sy-subrc NE 0.
        wa_message-type = 'E'.
        CONCATENATE 'PO ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.' INTO wa_message-text.
        APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*        MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH 'PO ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.'.
*        LEAVE TO TRANSACTION 'Z_PO_ADOBE'.
      ENDIF.

    WHEN 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'.
      SELECT SINGLE vbeln FROM vbrk INTO @DATA(lv_vbeln) WHERE vbeln = @iv_object_nr AND gjahr = @iv_fyear.
      IF sy-subrc NE 0.
        wa_message-type = 'E'.
        CONCATENATE 'Billing Document ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.' INTO wa_message-text.
        APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*        MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH 'Billing Document ' iv_object_nr ' does not exist.'.
*        LEAVE TO TRANSACTION 'Z_PO_ADOBE'.

      ENDIF.

  ENDCASE.


  lo_hlp = cl_apoc_or_h_factory_internal=>get_helper_factory( ).


  TRY.
      " Get form provide services
      lo_fp_srv = lo_hlp->get_somu_form_services( ).

      TRY.
          it_master_keys = ls_master_keys.
          it_key = ls_appl_keys.
          lo_fp_srv->get_document(
            EXPORTING
*        iv_master_form_name     = 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_ORDER_MASTER'
              iv_master_form_name            = pdf_mfor
*        iv_form_name            = 'ZZ1_DCP_MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER'
              iv_form_name            = pdf_form
              it_key                  = it_key
*        it_filter_select_option = ls_appl-filter_options
              it_master_key           = it_master_keys
              iv_form_language        = 'E'
              iv_form_country         = 'CA'
              is_render_options       = render_options
              iv_print_queue_name     = lv_pq_name
              iv_xml                  = lv_xml_in
              iv_disable_cache        = 'X'
            IMPORTING
              ev_content              = ev_document_data
              ev_pages                = ev_pages
              ev_stop_processing      = lv_stop
              et_message              = lt_msg
              ev_xml                  = lv_xml_out
              ev_pdl_type             = lv_pdl_type ).
          INSERT LINES OF lt_msg INTO TABLE lt_msg_all.

        CATCH cx_somu_error INTO DATA(error_somu).
          DATA(text_somu) = error_somu->get_text( ).
          wa_message-type = 'E'.
          wa_message-text = text_somu.
          APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*          MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_somu.
          sy-subrc = 98.
      ENDTRY.
    CATCH cx_apoc_extern_services INTO DATA(error_apoc_services).
      DATA(text_apoc) = error_apoc_services->get_text( ).
      wa_message-type = 'E'.
      wa_message-text = text_apoc.
      APPEND wa_message TO et_message.
*      MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_apoc.
  ENDTRY.

ENDFUNCTION.

entry.title: Re: Mapping not allowed. The model in project ZGW_HCM_MYTIMESHEET_X is redefining another mode
entry.content:
Hello,

I just had the same issue and managed to find the solution. You can add the mapping manually in the DPC class:

method if_sadl_gw_extension_control~set_extension_mapping https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/23969e5c00e1475283553381af0b1a12/a5f7c428514e4066bb24fd48fdd6ab70.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Object information for ADOBE PDF'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@OData.publish: true

define view entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V3

  with parameters
    @Consumption.defaultValue : 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM',
    // entity: { name: 'I_OutputControlApplObjectType',
                  element: 'iv_object_type'}
      }]
    p1_iv_object_type : apoc_appl_object_type,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '001'

    @EndUserText.label: 'PDF Version(1(SAP), 2(Custom)..etc'
    p2_iv_version_nr  : /accgo/e_ovd_version,
    //@Environment.systemField: #SYSTEM_DATE
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '2025'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Fiscal year'

    p3_iv_fyear       : /accgo/e_fiscal_year,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : 'xxxx'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Company Code'

    p4_iv_cc          : /accgo/e_companycode_vh

  as select from    zdcp_fp_pdf_form as objtype

  //as select from    ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM as objtype
  //as select from    I_OutputControlApplObjectType as objtype
  //association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
  //  left outer join zdcp_fp_pdf_form      as pdfform   on objtype.iv_object_type = pdfform.iv_object_type
  //    left outer join ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM              as pdfform on objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType = pdfform.iv_object_type
    left outer join ekko             as po         on  objtype.iv_object_type =  'PURCHASE_ORDER'
                                                   and po.bstyp               <> 'K'
    left outer join ekko             as pc         on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT'
                                                   and pc.bstyp               = 'K'
    left outer join vbrk             as bill       on objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
    left outer join vbak             as sales_con  on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT'
                                                   and sales_con.vbtyp        = 'G'
    left outer join vbak             as ord_conf   on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION'
                                                   and ord_conf.vbtyp         = 'C'
  //SALES_QUOTATION
    left outer join vbak             as sales_quot on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION'
                                                   and sales_quot.vbtyp       = 'B'
  //CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join vbak             as cred_memo  on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                   and cred_memo.vbtyp       = 'K'
  //DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join vbak             as debit_memo on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                   and debit_memo.vbtyp       = 'L'
  // association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
{
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 10
      } ]
      // @ui.selectionField: [{position: 10 }]
      // @Consumption.filter.defaultValue: 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
      @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'

      //   @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ObjType'
  key objtype.iv_object_type as iv_object_type,
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 20
      } ]
      @ui.selectionField: [{position: 20 }]
      @EndUserText.label: 'Document Number'
  key
      case
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then po.ebeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then pc.ebeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then bill.vbeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT' then sales_con.vbeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION' then ord_conf.vbeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION' then sales_quot.vbeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then cred_memo.vbeln
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then debit_memo.vbeln
      else 'Under Construction'
      end                    as iv_object_nr,
      @ui.lineItem: [{ type: #WITH_URL , url: 'valueLink', position: 30}]
      @EndUserText.label: 'PDF'
      @ObjectModel.readOnly: true
      'Download PDF->|'      as showPdf,
      case
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',po.ebeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', po.bukrs),''')/$value'))))))
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',pc.ebeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', pc.bukrs),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then
      // concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat('IvVersionNr=','000'),concat(concat('IvObjectNr=',bill.vbeln), concat(concat('IV_FYEAR=','0000'),concat('IV_CC=', bill.bukrs))))))
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',bill.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', bill.bukrs),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',sales_con.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',ord_conf.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',sales_quot.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',cred_memo.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',debit_memo.vbeln), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))

           else ''
          end                as valueLink
      //Associations
      // _ObjType
}
where
      objtype.iv_object_type = $parameters.p1_iv_object_type
  and objtype.iv_version_nr  = $parameters.p2_iv_version_nr

entry.title: Question About WebExtend Implementation
entry.content:
Hello SAP team,

 

We have a question regarding email tracking and revenue attribution.
In order to track email opens and view revenue attribution, is it necessary to implement WebExtend?

The client is interested in having visibility over these metrics but is not willing to implement WebExtend at this stage.
What would you recommend in this case?

Thank you in advance for your support.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Question About WebExtend Implementation
entry.content:
Hello,

 

I can confirm that for Email Open tracking, you don't need web extend as this feature only relies on the email data that is sent in the email messages. For revenue attribution, there are a few different data sources, including web extend. The Revenue Attribution Service uses one of the following data sources:

  • Web Extend session purchases (if Web Extend is activated on your account)
  • Smart Insight sales data (if Smart Insight is activated on your account)
  • Plugin Sales Data (if you are using the SAP Emarsys Shopify or Adobe Commerce plug-in)
  • Sales Data Batch Loads (if this solution is enabled in your account)

With that in mind, we can confirm that you don't need web extend to track email opens and revenue attribution.

 

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for July the 24th, 2025.  

[Kevin] Hey, SAP community, I'm happy to announce this year's Devtoberfest event, which is happening September 29th to October 24th. And again, it's a packed event with great sessions, live streams, with your favorite developer advocates, amazing people from SAP and the community giving sessions at Devtoberfest. The only thing you got to do is head over to the SAP community, join the Devtoberfest group to be part of Devtoberfest and see the session catalog see all the information there is an announcement blog post as well with all the dates the tracks and everything which is happening and what you have to know about the grand prize and the competition also we have the fun activities back this year where my colleague daniel is preparing some cool stuff there for you to enjoy and then get entertained and the only thing you really got to do is head over to the community join the devtoberfest group and  

[DJ] i see you there along with RAP UI5 and CAP are two of the poster children of today's generation of SAP development toolkits now binding see what i did there binding UI5 and CAP together is the venerable odata protocol one part of Odata that is a little bit orthogonal to the rest of Odata's design is the concept of actions and functions in bound and unbound playlists. Add that somewhat mysterious topic to the question of how best to make action and function calls from UI5, and you've got a really nice mystery conundrum to be resolved. Luckily, SAP community contributor extraordinaire marian size has exactly a blog post on this topic that is recently published it's called the complete guide to calling actions in UI5 with custom code and it covers all the subjects that i've mentioned and lots more moreover there's already some great discussion going on in the comments so head over to the blog post have a read of it learn from it and then in the comments maybe share your experiences and opinions. Toward the end, I demoed long-chain integration with SAP HANA Cloud Knowledge Graph Engine using Python. Want to try this hands-on? The first SAP call jump on this topic, Foundations of AI Applications with SAP HANA Cloud, is happening in Portal this September and then in Kuwait in October. Interested in hosting such an event? Let me know. If you are into using Python in SAP Business Application Studio, check out my latest blog post. Link in the description.  

[Rekha DR] Hello, everybody. Are you an enterprise automation expert or a business process owner working on enterprise automation? Here is the fantastic news. You can now import business process model and notation BPMN files into SAP Build Process Automation and convert them into executable business processes. SAP delivers enterprise automation with SAP Signavio and SAP Build Process Automation solutions. Using SAP Signavio Process Manager, you can model your business process and export the BPMN file. You could also use NetViewer BPM tool or any tool for that matter that supports process model creation and export as BPMN. Then import this file into SAP Build Process Automation to generate process extensions and automations. This follows a model to execute pattern and helps you migrate the processes easily to SAP Build Process Automation. If you want to understand how to carry out this task with a step-by-step guide with a business use case example, then do read through this excellent blog post by our enterprise automation expert, Rama Muradi. Link is provided in the description box. Keep learning and have a good time.

entry.title: Re: Snowflake Will Block Single-Factor Password Authentic...
entry.content:
There's a kb article for this now: 3608512 - How to configure BI Platform for Snowflake connections using Key-Pair (Private-Public key) - SAP for Me

This essentially just uses the Snowflake ODBC driver, and requires connection string parameters to be updated to include the keypair file location and passphrase.

I've tested this, and it works, but I have a couple of concerns:

  • If you're using IDT in "server middleware" mode, then the private key can be located on the server and the local workstation doesn't need a copy.  But if you're using UDT or CR, the private key has to be copied to the users' workstations. 
  • Any universe developer with rights to "download the connection" can view the connection parameters, which includes the passphrase.  

Both of these create a security risk.  Any way to mitigate them?

entry.title: Re: Snowflake Will Block Single-Factor Password Authentic...
entry.content:
I think for the universe connection, you can force you users to use their own "personal connection" and have their own key-pair to use while they are working modifying the universe and then change the connection back to the "Public" connection before they export it.  We do this sort of because we tell our Universe Developers to create a personal connection that is OLEDB for SQL Server so the Integrity Check runs better.  It should work for Snowflake as well.
If you use an ODBC DSN on the server for the ODBC connection instead of the connection string option, then your key-pair information is in the ODBC DSN on the server and not in the connection.  This prevents your users from being able to download it.  We have our connection set up with this method.

We have gone through one of the SAP blog, 

In the blog, it is mentioned that need to make changes in “BrandedSettings.Json” file as per the client details from “Mobile Services admin UI”

While Branding SSAM 2410 we didn’t do any changes in the BrandedSettings.Json file but still the branded application is working fine.

Do we need add all the highlighted lines in the BrandedSettings.Json file?

Does it impact the Branded SSAM 2410 App ?

Thanks.

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SSAM Branded APP file ID's
entry.content:
Hello,
Hope you are doing well.

For clarification, these json files will impact different behavior of your Application:
---
- BrandedSettings.json: Runtime configurations such as security settings, URLs for connecting to the SAP Business Technology Platform Mobile Services, and more
- MDKProject.json: Build time configurations such as the application name, version, and bundle ID
---
About your doubts, the App build should be working but the future user onboarding and other connection events should be verified: in case you are not planning to use SSAM client from the App Store, how will the onboarding for user be happening ?

Without and onboarding QR Code, you cuold be using BrandedSettings to define the connections to be used by default.
Nevertheless, the need for the QR Code is so the client knows where to connect in order to onboard to the correct application / identity provider.

In terms of options today, you can

1) Brand your own client that hardcodes the connection information. You can release your client to the public or private app stores for users to install

2) Have users copy and load an Overrides.json file to their device which contains the connection information. More steps than just scanning the QR code.

3) Provide an internal webpage for users to visit from their device with a link to click that contains the same information in the QR code. 

Last but not least, I suggest to follow up on the dedicated SSAM guide for branding: https://help.sap.com/docs/service-asset-manager/sap-service-and-asset-manager-installation-guide/building-sap-service-and-asset-manager-application-client?version=2410&locale=en-US  

Kind regards,
Douglas

Proration: 4%

Prpration: 45%

Target Amount: 32583 kr

Proration: 52%

Target Amount: 37651 kr

Then Spanish assignment where the target is 32583 kr - there is a specific business performance percent (we are using direct method here so it is a specific result percent that will be provided) which is 130% and the individual contribution here is 90%  - the total incentive payout for this one should be: 38122 kr

Then Spanish assignment where the target is 37651 kr - there is a specific business performance percent (we are using direct method here so it is a specific result percent that will be provided) which is 120% and the individual contribution here is 100%  - the total incentive payout for this one should be: 45181kr

 

And at the end the total payout for this employee would be: 86408kr

 

Does that make sense?

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori elements extension: upload Excel files to create new entries using building blocks
entry.content:
Hi @marcel_waechter,

Thank you for your reply.  

Q1: Did you follow the same steps as in the referenced blog and mine?

A1: I followed the same steps as the reference blog, and uploading with the FileUploader is working as expected (branch: FileUploader). The difference from your application is that your application is using a XML View whereas mine is using a fragment with a controller extension. 

Q2: Is the excel property edit enabled?

A2: I am not sure how to enable edit for the excel property. The entity definition is as follows:

using my.bookshop as my from '../db/schema';

service CatalogService {
    @readonly entity Books as projection on my.Books;

    @cds.persistence.skip
    @odata.singleton
    @odata.draft.enabled
    entity ExcelUpload {
        @Core.MediaType : 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet'
        excel: LargeBinary; 
        dummy: String; 
    }
}

Q3: Which UI5 version did you use?

A3: I used 1.136.1.

Q4: You can test it by adding any other property of your entity in the dialog, and see if it's shown readonly, or in edit mode. You might add another string or integer property into the singleton type, and try to render this one in the dialog. Does this work?

A4: I have added a dummy field to the singleton entity as shown above. It was rendered as read-only as well.

Fragment definition

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
    xmlns="sap.m" 
    xmlns:macros="sap.fe.macros" >

    <Dialog 
        id="uploadDialog" 
        title="Upload Excel File" 
        contentWidth="500px" 
        contentHeight="300px"
        beforeOpen=".onBeforeOpen"
        afterClose=".onAfterClose"> 

    <content> 
        <macros:Field id="excelFile" metaPath="/ExcelUpload/excel" /> 
        <macros:Field id="dummy" metaPath="/ExcelUpload/dummy" /> 
    </content> 

    <beginButton> 
      <Button id="closeButton" text="Close" press=".closeDialog" /> 
    </beginButton> 

  </Dialog> 
    
</core:FragmentDefinition>

Controller extension

import ExtensionAPI from 'sap/fe/core/ExtensionAPI';
import Context from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/Context';
import Dialog, { Dialog$AfterCloseEvent, Dialog$BeforeOpenEvent } from 'sap/m/Dialog';
import ODataModel from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/ODataModel';

/**
 * Generated event handler.
 *
 * @param this reference to the 'this' that the event handler is bound to.
 * @param pageContext the context of the page on which the event was fired
 */
export function upload(this: ExtensionAPI, pageContext: Context) {
    this.loadFragment({
        id: "exelUploadDialog",
        name: "ns.books.ext.fragment.ExcelUploadDialog",
        controller: dialogController(this)
    }).then(dialog => {
        const model = this.getModel() as ODataModel;
        (dialog as Dialog).setModel(model);
        (dialog as Dialog).open();
    })
}

function dialogController(extensionAPI: ExtensionAPI) {
    let dialog: Dialog | undefined

    return {
        onBeforeOpen: function (evnet: Dialog$BeforeOpenEvent) {
            dialog = evnet.getSource() as Dialog;
            extensionAPI.addDependent(dialog);            
        },

        onAfterClose: function (event: Dialog$AfterCloseEvent) {
            if (dialog) {
                extensionAPI.removeDependent(dialog);
                dialog.destroy();
                dialog = undefined;
            }
        },

        closeDialog: function () {
            dialog?.close();
        }
    }
}

entry.title: JOINVILLE no SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil
entry.content:
O SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil vai ocorrer nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto de 2025, no Transamerica Expo Center, em São Paulo. Este evento é uma evolução significativa no conceito SAP NOW, com foco total na Inteligência Artificial integrada ao ERP e nuvem, reunindo líderes de grandes empresas, especialistas SAP e parceiros para discutir tendências, casos reais de IA, transformação digital, sustentabilidade e gestão empresarial.

Relevância do evento

  • Networking estratégico: CEOs, CIOs, tomadores de decisão e executivos de diversas funções (TI, RH, operações, finanças) vão se encontrar para trocar experiências e fechar parcerias .

  • Conteúdo de ponta: keynotes com Rui Botelho, Adriana Aroulho, Muhammad Alam e outros líderes, além de sessões paralelas com demos de IA generativa aplicada a ERP, cadeia de suprimentos, RH, customer experience etc.

  • Transformação real: demonstrações ao vivo, painéis inspiradores (com figuras como Regina Casé e Gustavo Werneck) e show de encerramento com Toni Garrido tornam a experiência rica e memorável.

Empresas de Santa Catarina que estarão presentes

  • Ramo Sistemas (Base: Joinville) – patrocínio Silver. O seu destaque será a apresentação do SAP Cloud ERP com IA nativa (Joule), incluindo adequação à reforma tributária e automações inteligentes.

  • MakeValue , também de Joinville, é patrocinadora e parceira SAP, reforçando a presença catarinense com cases voltados para a Conectividade Bancária com o SAP.

Essas empresas mostram a força do ecossistema de tecnologia de Santa Catarina, especialmente Joinville, no contexto da transformação digital nacional.

Patrocinadores do evento

  • Deloitte
  • EY

O SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil 2025 é um marco para as empresas que desejam alavancar IA dentro de soluções SAP. A presença de patrocinadores catarinenses como Ramo e MakeValue TVM evidencia o protagonismo regional em tecnologia e inovação. Será uma excelente oportunidade para fortalecer redes, aprender com cases reais e planejar a próxima fase da transformação digital nas empresas.

Não perca a oportunidade de vivenciar o futuro da transformação digital no SAP NOW AI 2025!

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Munich 2025 | Call for Speakers 📢 #sitMUC25
entry.content:
The SAP Inside Track Munich (#sitMUC) is back ...

Dear SAP Community,

On October 11th, the SAP community will gather once again in Garching for a day full of learning, sharing, and connecting .. and we want you to be part of it.

Whether you're deep into ABAP, building apps on SAP BTP, working with Fiori, S/4HANA, or Analytics, exploring DevOps in SAP, or shaping business processes, driving change in projects, or navigating transformation from a consulting perspective, your insights matter. Our audience comes from all corners of the SAP universe: developers, consultants, architects, product experts, and curious newcomers. That’s why we’re looking for diverse session ideas: technical deep dives, lessons learned from projects, open-source initiatives, or even side projects that others can learn from. It doesn’t have to be perfect or polished. If it’s real and relevant to the community, it belongs on stage.

Important dates and submission process:

  • Call opens: July 24st
  • Submission deadline: August 30th
  • Speaker selection: by September 5th
  • Please submit your proposal using our online form:
    sitmuc.cfapps.eu12.hana.ondemand.com

There are various session types for your submissions:

  • Short Presentation (20 min)
  • Presentation (40 min)
    you will present a topic to the audience demos, theory, live coding, or anything else that suits your expertise
  • Marketplace
    you will share your topic in a “marketplace” breakout session where everyone is welcome to walk around, visit the various stands, and interact

What we’re looking for:

  • On-site only we’ll be together in person!
  • No marketing pitches – just genuine value for the community

We’d love to hear your ideas whether you’re a seasoned speaker or presenting for the very first time. Let’s make #sitMUC25 another unforgettable community event.

If you're unsure about your topic, format, or how to present it no worries! Just drop us an email at contact@sitmuc.com, we're happy to help. Or better yet: join our next Stammtisch meetup (14.08.), and let’s chat about your session idea in person.

Let’s build this day together. Bring your voice, your story, your topic. We can’t wait to hear it!

Best regards,
sitMUC Orga team

entry.title: Re: Integration between S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and...
entry.content:
Hello @JordanoJ 

Thank you for your question regarding the integration of SAP S/4HANA public cloud with a bank using SFTP. You're correct that this process falls under Scope Item 1EG and utilises the BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN SOAP interface.

However, the standard setup does not require converting the WSDL structure into a .txt file. Instead, banks typically send CAMT.053 or MT940 files via SFTP to SAP Integration Suite or a middleware.

The middleware then maps and transmits the content via the SOAP service into S/4HANA Cloud. Refer to the SAP documentation below

  • KBA-3374309 - Processing rules in bank statement posting - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP API Business Hub – BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN
  • Overview on Automatic Bank Statement Processing-SAP HELP

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Pasar identificador unico de usuario desde app móvil a app SAPUI5 embebida
entry.content:
Hola a todos,
Quisiera pedirles ayuda a quienes hayan logrado algo similar y me puedan orientar.

Tengo un desarrollo web hecho con SAPUI5 , el cual ya está listo y embebido dentro de una aplicación móvil . El flujo es el siguiente:

  • El usuario accede primero a la aplicación móvil.

  • En ese ingreso, la aplicación móvil captura la cédula del usuario (como identificador único).

  • Luego, dentro de esa misma aplicación móvil, se carga la aplicación SAPUI5 embebida.

Lo que necesito es que, al momento de ingresar a la aplicación web, esta pueda recibir esa cédula enviada desde la aplicación móvil , para que el desarrollo haga automáticamente un filtro de datos y muestre la información correspondiente al usuario.

Agradezco mucho si alguien ha realizado este tipo de integración y puede compartirme cómo lo logró o qué debo tener en cuenta.

Saludos

entry.title: Re: Time-based revenue recognition in the public cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Naveenk_S42024 

Thank you for your question.

For time-based revenue recognition in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using Revenue Accounting and Reporting (RAR), the relevant scope item is

Scope Item: 3IF – Revenue Accounting (Event-Based)
This scope item supports IFRS 15-compliant revenue recognition, including capabilities for time-based revenue recognition through performance obligations (POBs), contract management, and integration with Sales and Distribution (SD).

Key references to check

  • SAP Best Practices for 3IF (login required)
  • SAP Help – Event-Based Revenue Recognition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Best Practices for Onboarding and MiniEC – With a Focus on Offboarding and Crossboarding
entry.content:
Is there any more standard SAP guidance on using BIB Replication for Onboardees to replicate to S/4? If S/4 (SAP ERP as the HCM system) does the hiring HCM actions, and then using the same replication of S/4 to Employee Central after they're hired; per the same steps you're referring too but with specifics involving EC Minimaster? All guidance on BIB replication focus on if you using full blown Employee Central with BIB Replication because EC is the source. There doesn't seem to be consistent materials on ONB 2.0 upgrade utilizing EC mini and also using S/4 (ERP/SAP) as your HRIS system still. 

Reference from the blog with some notes in red:

"Employee Data Replication

Employee Data replication, as per Best Practice, must be implemented using Business Integration Builder (BIB). BIB framework includes configuration layer, reports for triggering Organizational and Employees Data replication on backend side, it takes advantage of prepackaged Integration Flows on BTP Integration Suite and of the SuccessFactors oData API to upsert data into Employee Central entities (that means Crossboarding and Offboarding processes can be triggered from every external tool using SuccessFactors oData APIs for updating employees data). As of the last note we saw crossboarding and offboarding is not supported in EC mini. 

BIB configuration documentation for replicating Employee and Organizational Data from SAP ERP HCM to Employee Central can be found at following link: Introduction to Employee Data Replication to Employee Central"

No clear documentation on both sending data from ONB/EC to ERP, processing actions in SAP S/4, and then sending back to EC mini after hiring is finished in S/4 regarding using BIB replication in both ways in this scenario. Most documentation simply states "build a custom integration". Yours is the first to really point out leveraging BIB but a bit unclear on best practices for both ways.

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Time-based revenue recognition in the public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Naveen,

For time-based revenue recognition:-

3KK: Contract-Based Revenue Recognition - Professional Services (This is a key one for service contracts and projects)
3VS: Contract-Based Revenue Recognition - Subscription Billing (If you're using SAP Subscription Billing for your packages)

It's important to note that with recent releases (starting with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408), SAP has introduced Universal Revenue Recognition (URR). URR aims to combine the capabilities of both Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR) and Contract-Based Revenue Recognition (CBRR) into a unified framework. If you choose to implement URR, you would still consider 3KK and 3VS as relevant for the CBRR aspects, in addition to any EBRR scope items for your specific integration scenarios.

Appreciate your feedback.

entry.title: Re: External tax procedure - Vertex interface setup issue...
entry.content:
Hi @Govind_Sharma ,

Below is my inline response

1. This message usually appears when you're trying to activate or transport configuration changes and the system is checking for lock status or dependencies in the target systems - like Q or P.
Certain configuration activities are currently locked in the target system - like Q or P. You need to unlock or release those locks before you can proceed with the change or transport.

2. It is highly complex and generally not recommended to change the tax procedure for company codes that already have financial postings. which are "LIVE"

3. If your business requirement explicitly states the need for Vertex for Canada, it implies a scenario that goes beyond the standard 4Q2 scope for Canada. You would need to engage with SAP directly (via incident or consulting) to discuss the feasibility and the required approach for integrating Vertex for Canadian tax calculation in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. They would advise if a standard solution is becoming available, or if a specific extensibility project is needed.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Bex query cannot distinguish between key and text in new line
entry.content:
hello

Bex query cannot distinguish between key and text in new line..

 

The first case.
We use an info object "A". For example, aaa as the key value for it, and the text of aaa is "apple".

In the related query, A is displayed as text, so the user will type it as "apple" in the new line.

However, since the key value of apple exists in A's master table (key: apple, text: application),

the value is entered as an "application".

The second case.
we use an info object "B". This is also displayed as  text in the query.

For this, C is a compound. The value of C is ccc. (constant value. So of course, it's in fixed filter)
There is bbb as the value of B info object. The text is "banana".
However, if you type "banana" in the new line, a warning occurs that the compound  value has not been entered.

Why can't bex query distinguish between key and text input?

entry.title: Re: KEA5_How to define a new character(WWXXX) with option...
entry.content:
Hello @Cjjchujunchen ,

When you try to create a custom characteristic (e.g., WWABC1) in KEA5, SAP asks you to choose the origin of the characteristic. If you choose origin type "1 – User-defined characteristic", then it’s a user-defined characteristic, the table and field entries are locked/grayed out
This is standard SAP behavior — you cannot manually select a field/table for user-defined characteristics.

If you choose Origin = 2 – Table field, then, you’ll be able to select - A table name (e.g., KNA1, VBRK, etc.) - A field name from that table (e.g., LAND1, SPART, etc.)
Please note only transparent tables are allowed (not structures or pooled/clustered tables)

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Overall Status Description Customization in Test Suit...
entry.content:
Test status description is maintained in the following data elements for respective colors.

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_GREEN

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_YELLOW

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_RED

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_BLUE

 

Choose any one of the following solutions best suited to your business requirement.

 

1.Update the standard data element label

Tcode CMOD->GOTO->Text Enhancements-> Keyword->Change.

Enter Data element and add custom label.

Note: This impacts all the reports.

During upgrade this has to be manually changed else the original settings will be updated.

 

2. Enhance Method CL_SMT_CUST_UTIL=>GET_TEXT_4_TCSE_STATUS_COLOR_1 - this will impact multiple places.

3. Enhance method CL_SMT_RPT_TPLN_REPORTING=>BUILD_TPLN_TPCK_TCSE_HIER, field name status_color_txt in itab ET_TPLN_STATUS_INTREE. -this will be called in tpln report also in tpck report.( Note : This is preferred solution as this does not impact other areas)

entry.title: Re: Use of statistical projects
entry.content:
Hello @FranciscoCosta ,

A statistical project is used for reporting and analysis only. It does not carry actual costs — instead, all real financial impact is assigned to a real cost object (like a cost center). The statistical project acts as an additional dimension for internal tracking.

-No real impact on financial statements
-Requires a real cost object in parallel for every posting
-Used for internal cost tracking, time recording, or reporting
-Not suitable for billing, budgeting, or settlement

Best Practice Use Cases
-Internal Time Tracking: For non-billable work like R&D or training
-Overhead Cost Breakdown: Granular cost tracking under large cost centers
-Cross-Department Initiatives: Unified reporting for programs like “Sustainability”
-Marketing Campaigns: Track campaign costs without revenue posting

You can post:

-Supplier invoices
-Manual journal entries
-Internal activity allocations
-Timesheets
-Purchase requisitions/orders
-Goods receipts

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh
